text: Evidence was obtained that the Purkinje cells of the hemispheres derive from the lateral cerebellar primordium capping the lateral recess of the fourth ventricle anteriorly.

The young Purkinje cells migrate from the neuroepithelium to the surface of the cerebellum in a strictly caudal-to-rostral order, paralleling the spread of the EGL superficially from posteroventral to anterodorsal.

In the anterior vermis the Purkinje cells of lobulus centralis, which follow an anterodorsal migratory course, are still settling on day E22, 7 days after their production, presumably awaiting the fusion of the cerebellar base anteriorly.

text: We found that 1) supramammillary(SUM) afferents reached the dentate juxtagranular and CA2 pyramidal cell layers at midgestation in human fetuses, earlier than in monkeys (two-thirds of gestation [E109]).

[1999] Neuroscience 88:701); and 4) in addition, a large band of calretinin-labeled terminals that did not co-express substance P, glutamic acid decarboxylase(GAD) , or acetylcholinesterase was present in the deepest one-third of the dentate molecular layer in both the Cynomolgus monkey and human fetuses.

text: This area differs from the corresponding region in the cat in that it receives direct projections from the lateral geniculate nucleus and from areas 17 and 18.
The bulk of the projection to area 17 is derived from the principal layers, A and A1, while most cells projecting to areas 18 and SV are found in the C-layer complex.

text: In contrast, FGF-2- immunoreactivity(IR) appears in many perikarya of the red nucleus and the medial nucleus of the trapezoid body, whereas in control rats both nuclei showed immunostained fibers and almost no immunoreactive cell bodies.
The red nucleus and the medial nucleus of the trapezoid body may synthesize FGF-2 and provide the growth factor to afferent or efferent neurons.
